--- "Jeff Grigg" <jeffgrigg@c...> wrote:
> In essence, the 'appendTo()' method, in the IMoney interface,
> as implemented in the MoneyBag class does not (and cannot)
> return a new  Money instance if doing appendTo results in
> a MoneyBag with only one currency in it.  [...]
> 
> I think that 'appendTo()' is intended to be an implementation 
> detail, not a method in a general purpose public interface, but it 
> is implemented as a public method in the IMoney interface.

MoneyBag is intended to be a Value Object, isn't it?

So 'appendTo' shouldn't be part of its interface.
